name: Overview
main:
Floods in northern and central areas of the country in August and September 2017 affected almost 7 million people, with 3 million needing targeted assistance for WASH, food, nutrition, and shelter assistance.? At the same time, an influx of Rohingya refugees into Cox’s Bazar in the southeast of the country has been steadily increasing since late August, with the current number at over 688,000. Needs among Rohingya are high, as they flee a major government crackdown in Rakhine state, Myanmar. Prior to this development, Bangladesh was already hosting almost 212,000 Rohingya refugees.

INFORM measures Bangladesh's risk of humanitarian crisis and disaster to be high, at 5.8/10. Bangladesh’s exposure to hazards is of particular concern, at 7.5/10.?
latest_developments_past:
22/01: The repatration proccess which could see  up to 1,500 Rohingya returns per week over two years, was delayed by Bangladeshi authorities.?

10/01: Harsh winter conditions exacerbate shelter and NFI needs of Rohingya population in Bangladesh with at least 34 deaths reported due to cold weather.
